text:
Some notable figures associated with flat Earth theories include:

   • Samuel Rowbotham (1816-1884), an English inventor and writer who

     proposed a flat Earth model based on his observations of the horizon

     (Rowbotham's Flat Earth).

   • Charles K. Johnson (1924-2008), a South African engineer and founder of

     the Flat Earth Society, which was established in 1956 to promote flat

     Earth theories (Flat Earth Society).

Conclusion

The origins of flat Earth theories are complex and multifaceted, spanning
